snippet: Proponents see hemp as a source of agricultural jobs, an alternative for struggling farmers and a wonder plant with uses from bluejeans to building materials.
abstract: Kentucky may join eight other states that have adopted laws to allow commercial hemp growing, although practice is blocked by federal law that makes no distinction between hemp and marijuana; hemp's champions see it as a source of agricultural jobs, an alternative for struggling tobacco farmers and a wonder plant with uses from bluejeans to building materials.
lead_paragraph: Proponents see hemp as a source of agricultural jobs, an alternative for struggling farmers and a wonder plant with uses from bluejeans to building materials.

headline.main: Hemp Growing Finds Allies of a New Stripe in Kentucky
headline.print_headline: Hemp Growing Finds Allies of a New Stripe in Kentucky
